arm_group.description: 67 consecutive male patients with OSA were recruited: 36 with mild-moderate OSA and 31 with severe OSA. Data were collected in all subjects at baseline and after 1 month of CPAP.

brief_summary.textblock:
Reduced plasma nitrate (NOx) levels and increased urinary norepinephrine (U-NE) levels have
      been described in severe obstructive sleep apnea (OSA), and are reverted by continuous
      positive airway pressure (CPAP). The investigators wanted to know the effect of CPAP on
      these biomarkers in mild-moderate OSA.

clinical_study.brief_title: Efficacy Study of CPAP on Nitrate and Norepinephrine Levels in Severe and Mild-moderate Sleep Apnea (SABIO)

detailed_description.textblock:
The investigators aimed to compare NOx and U-NE levels and blood pressure (BP) between male
      patients with mild-moderate and severe OSA and determine the impact of 1 month of CPAP
      therapy on these parameters.

      The investigators undertook a prospective study of 67 consecutive OSA patients (36
      mild-moderate, 31 severe). Measurements of plasma NOx at 11 pm, 4 am and 7 am, 24-h U-NE and
      ambulatory BP were obtained at baseline and after 1 month of CPAP.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

        - Diagnosis of obstructive sleep apnea

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  current smoker

          -  respiratory disease

          -  cardiac disease (except for arterial hypertension)

          -  renal disorder

          -  hepatic disorder

          -  psychiatric disorder

          -  diabetes mellitus

          -  dyslipidemia

          -  rhinitis

          -  sinusitis

          -  acute illness

          -  daytime hypoxemia or hypercapnia

          -  therapy with oral nitrates

          -  therapy with angiotensin-converting enzyme inhibitors

          -  therapy with beta-blockers

          -  therapy with statins

          -  therapy with non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drugs

          -  presence of central respiratory events

          -  previous CPAP therapy

          -  previous uvulopalatopharyngoplasty

intervention.description: CPAP adaptation was performed by a sleep technician and the patients were instructed to use this for 1 month.
intervention.other_name: Automated pressure setting device (AutoSet Spirit, ResMed)

clinical_study.official_title: Effects of CPAP on Nitrate and Norepinephrine Levels in Severe and Mild-moderate Sleep Apnea

oversight_info.authority: Portugal: Ethics Committee for Clinical Research

primary_outcome.description: After sleep apnea diagnosis, measurements of plasma NOx at 11 pm, 4 am and 7 am were obtained at baseline and after 1 month of CPAP.

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: Ambulatory BP were obtained at baseline and after 1 month of CPAP.
After sleep apnea diagnosis, measurements of urinary norepinephrine levels were obtained at baseline and after 1 month of CPAP.

clinical_study.study_design: Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Single Group Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Treatment
